title: handle dockerfile, gitlab, github, tekton build files with static image refs better

labels.name: kind/epic
labels.description: Large issue with links to sub-issues

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

body:
#21980 is the latest in multiple situations where we have an artifact with references to container images and specific assumptions on what kind of packaging and deployment is going to happen.

The same situation plays out with dockerfiles (we now have multiple generated for this reason), github action (not done because of this issue), tekton (awaiting on buildpacks to provide uniform setup) and probably even more that we don't (yet) care about.

The issue is that which approach is taken depends on the application your are making (cli or service) and what kind of packaging (jar or native, inside container or not), should a dockerfile setup ssh/ssl settings, is kafka needing a special client ?

We already have one place we can adapt to the application needs and that is kubernetes yaml - these are generated based on the application and what extension are active Â± properties.

We probably still want a dockerfile, github/gitlab etc. generated at project creation but how about we then provide ways to (re)generate them based on extensions the current application includes. i.e. only add kafka setup if kafka extension are present. Do it one way when using platform A over using platform B.
